options.label: C
options.text: It has a negative impact on the environment

options.label: D
options.text: It has no impact on the environment

options.text: A person yawns due to a physical injury

options.text: A person yawns due to a physical injury

title: Toward a science of simplicity - George Whitesides

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of the speaker's talk about Simplicity?

options.label: A
options.text: Simplicity is a complex concept that is difficult to define.

options.label: B
options.text: Simplicity is about creating something that is reliable, predictable, and cheap.

options.label: C
options.text: Simplicity is a characteristic of complex systems.

options.label: D
options.text: Simplicity is not an important concept in design.

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a simple device that can be used to test for kidney function?

options.label: C
options.text: A paper chip with a few things printed on it.

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept of emergence in the context of complex systems?

options.label: A
options.text: The ability of a system to exhibit behavior that can be predicted from its individual components.

options.label: B
options.text: The ability of a system to exhibit behavior that cannot be predicted from its individual components.

options.label: C
options.text: The ability of a system to create new components.

options.label: D
options.text: The ability of a system to destroy its individual components.

multiple-choice.question: What is the characteristic of simple things that makes them useful?

options.label: B
options.text: Their ability to serve as building blocks.

options.text: The internet is a complex system that is difficult to understand.

options.label: C
options.text: The internet is a simple system that can be easily understood.

options.label: D
options.text: The internet is not a relevant example of a complex system.

options.label: A
options.text: The ability of a system to create new components.

options.label: C
options.text: The ability of a system to combine simple components to create a complex system.

options.label: D
options.text: The ability of a system to predict its individual components.

multiple-choice.question: What is the characteristic of simple things that makes them useful in design?

options.label: B
options.text: Their ability to serve as building blocks.

options.label: A
options.text: Simplicity is a complex concept that is difficult to define.

options.text: Simplicity is about creating something that is reliable, predictable, and cheap.
